intro: Bupleurum breviradiatum, commonly known as the short-rayed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant often produces small, spherical fruits. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and wastelands.
